qas.question: At an extremely large airport, what is in place but not usually used?
What is the frequency called that is used by departing aircraft for the purpose of requesting approach clearance?
Which aircraft request approach clearance while they are still hours away from the airport?
What do aircraft use instead of requesting approach clearance at very large airports?

plausible_answers.text: while they are still hours away from the airport, often before they even take off from their departure point

qas.question: When do large aircraft request to use a circuit?

plausible_answers.text: take the most direct approach path to the runway and land

qas.question: What does a circuit allow an aircraft to do without having to worry about other aircraft?

plausible_answers.text: controllers can predict whether an aircraft will be delayed on landing before it even takes off

qas.question: How has the advanced circuit system helped pilots?

plausible_answers.text: usually only commercial with long routes
